solution_line_template: First, the initial, pre-inflation, cost of the project was {initial_lumber_cost} + {initial_nails_cost} + {initial_fabric_cost} = $<<{initial_lumber_cost}+{initial_nails_cost}+{initial_fabric_cost}={initial_total_cost}>>{initial_total_cost}.
Then, the price of the lumber increased to {initial_lumber_cost}*{lumber_increase_factor} = $<<{initial_lumber_cost}*{lumber_increase_factor}={new_lumber_cost}>>{new_lumber_cost}.
Similarly, the price of the nails increased to {initial_nails_cost}*{nails_increase_factor} = $<<{initial_nails_cost}*{nails_increase_factor}={new_nails_cost}>>{new_nails_cost}.
And the price of the fabric increased to {initial_fabric_cost}*{fabric_increase_factor} = $<<{initial_fabric_cost}*{fabric_increase_factor}={new_fabric_cost}>>{new_fabric_cost}.

Therefore, the new, post-inflation, cost of the project is {new_lumber_cost} + {new_nails_cost} + {new_fabric_cost} = $<<{new_lumber_cost}+{new_nails_cost}+{new_fabric_cost}={new_total_cost}>>{new_total_cost}.
Thus, the cost has increased by {new_total_cost} - {initial_total_cost} = $<<{new_total_cost}-{initial_total_cost}={cost_increase}>>{cost_increase}.
